site.description: Downstream of "Westwood Estate" and informal housing.

sitedescription: Downstream of "Westwood Estate" and informal housing.
comment: Found a big change from an overgrown narrow deep sandy channel to a wide shallow meandering open river. Not many aquatic creatures, just one tiny tadpole. E.coli 10 cfu/100ml.

site.description: 18.17km. 317 MSL (PEFCO) Side stream from industrial area.

sitedescription: 18.17km. 317 MSL (PEFCO) Side stream from industrial area.
comment: Further undermined and collapsing bank and sewer line caused by storm-water flow is again being worked on. Few signs of life in this stream. A few aquatic creatures, mongoose spoor and one large plattana - Xenopus laevis. 1597  cfu/100ml.

site.description: Near the Road-over-River Bridge

sitedescription: Near the Road-over-River Bridge
comment: Ilona and Lee did not find many aquatic creatures, just one tiny tadpole, Mahomed Desai confirmed photo of red caddisflies.

site.description: Near the UKZN Gate. Steep eroded path through thick bush to access the river. Subject to regular sewage contamination from the Derby Downs sewer line.

sitedescription: Near the UKZN Gate. Steep eroded path through thick bush to access the river. Subject to regular sewage contamination from the Derby Downs sewer line.
comment: Assessed by Lee and Ilona. The river is flowing steadily following gentle rain all day before, quite muddy: 38mm Westville North 25mm in Mannors. Scant aquatic life. E.coli 15531 cfu/ml.

site.description: 49 Shepstone Place. 7.33 km. Desh Pillay's lovely cliff view riverside garden.

sitedescription: 49 Shepstone Place. 7.33 km. Desh Pillay's lovely cliff view riverside garden.
comment: Assessed by Lee and Ilona. The river is flowing steadily after rain the day before, quite muddy. Found just one caddisfly, so can not score. Almost no aquatic life. E.coli 5172cfu/100ml.

site.description: Very Rocky Shallow Little Vegetation.Shaded. By braai area at Edgecliffe Road entrance.

sitedescription: Very Rocky Shallow Little Vegetation.Shaded. By braai area at Edgecliffe Road entrance.
comment: Following wave after wave of pollution the river is almost devoid of aquatic life. Mahomed joined us to undertake a miniSASS test.  The only creature found was one tiny crab; so we allocated a Score 0 Condition Critical NO LIFE!! E.coli 5172 cfu/100ml.

site.description: At an old weir near the Roger Sishi bridge.

sitedescription: At an old weir near the Roger Sishi bridge.

comment: The water is murky and the river bed is covered with a deposit and dead algae, no aquatic insect tracks, very few creatures in the river. E.Coli 4106 cfu/100ml.

site.description: Upstream of the confluence. Sample taken in the Mbongokazi Stream just before it joins the Palmiet River. Mountbatten Drive, Shell Azmuth Motors

site.description: Near the Road-over-River Bridge

sitedescription: Near the Road-over-River Bridge
comment: Clear water with lots of trash and a \smell of sewage, an abundance of creatures mostly midge larvae, lots of waste, and invasive alien vegetation on the river banks. E. coli: <24196 cfu/100ml.

site.description: Downstream of "Westwood Estate" and informal housing.

sitedescription: Downstream of "Westwood Estate" and informal housing.
comment: This river bed is disturbed sand and gravel; while the adjacent land is seriously modified and covered with invasive alien vegetation. The river water was clear and all the creatures we caught were young. E. coli: 10462 cfu/100ml.

comment: The river water was clear, with an abundance of Minnow Mayflies. E. coli: 683 cfu/100ml.

comment: The aquatic creatures have been impacted by regular upstream sewage and industrial trade effluent pollution events. E. coli: 3654 cfu/100ml.

site.description: At an old weir near the Roger Sishi bridge.

sitedescription: At an old weir near the Roger Sishi bridge.
comment: Clear river water; but there are not many creatures. Saw few tadpoles, a red dragon fly and a pair of Egyptian Geese.  E. coli: 6131 cfu/100ml.

site.description: Below Methven Road Sewer Pump Station

sitedescription: Below Methven Road Sewer Pump Station
comment: The river water was very clear, with some creatures on the vegetated sides, but few on the river bed and rocks.  A few tadpoles and one tiny fish. E. coli: 4360 cfu/100ml.

site.description: 16.76km 305MSL At the Birdhurst Road Weir.

sitedescription: 16.76km 305MSL At the Birdhurst Road Weir.
comment: Subjected to repeated upstream pollution events, and recent reports of increased flow. Smelling strongly of chemicals with oil waste visible along the river edge. E. coli: 14136 cfu/100ml.

site.description: Downstream of Pinetown/New Germany Industrial Areas, and Blair Road Sewer Pump Station.

sitedescription: Downstream of Pinetown/New Germany Industrial Areas, and Blair Road Sewer Pump Station.
comment: Sewage visible entering the Palmiet River at Churston Road Servitude, Ref No: F180801/947. Few aquatic creatures. Mahomed did a SASS 5: Score 31; No of Taxa 9; ASPT 3.4 (miniSSAS Score: 33/7=4.71 VERY POOR Seriously modified).  E. coli: >24196 cfu/100ml

site.description: This site was sampled from a certain distance from the actual stream. This is at a storm water culvert in a residential area which has been abused for years by illegal pollutants in the adjacent Pinetown Industrial Area. This flows into the Palmiet River.

sitedescription: This site was sampled from a certain distance from the actual stream. This is at a storm water culvert in a residential area which has been abused for years by illegal pollutants in the adjacent Pinetown Industrial Area. This flows into the Palmiet River.
comment: Murky, petroleum smell, two creatures! Mahomed did a SASS 5: Score 4; No of Taxa 1; ASPT 4. (miniSASS Score: 6/1=6.00 POOR Largely modified). Frequently polluted with trash, sewage, oil, chemicals, detergents and waste water. E. coli: 12023 cfu/100ml.

site.description: Upstream of the (Mixed Industrial & Domestic) Blair Road Sewer Pump Station at the lower end of Pinetown/ New Germany Industrial Areas. 18.17km

sitedescription: Upstream of the (Mixed Industrial & Domestic) Blair Road Sewer Pump Station at the lower end of Pinetown/ New Germany Industrial Areas. 18.17km
comment: Clear river water with very few aquatic creatures; and a lot of trash (plastic and rubble). Mahomed conducted a SASS 5: Score 10; No of Taxa 4; ASPT 2.5.  (MiniSASS score 8/3=2.67 CRITICAL Critically modified). E. coli: 11199 cfu/100ml.

site.description: 17 Cherry Road. In Pinetown Industrial Area. Subject to ongoing pollution. Palmiet River Watch reported and a number of polluters were traced, warned or give admition of guilt fines. 19.65km

sitedescription: 17 Cherry Road. In Pinetown Industrial Area. Subject to ongoing pollution. Palmiet River Watch reported and a number of polluters were traced, warned or give admition of guilt fines. 19.65km
comment: The river water was clear with signs of recent pollution, with a thick oil slick where the vegetation was disturbed and a strong smell of petroleum. There were a few sluggish aquatic creatures. E. coli: 6488   cfu/100ml.
